spell.name: Artist's Touch

components.m: a paint bruch, quill or similar artistic tool

entries: You conjure from the tip of your brush or quill a single magical effect as a manifestation of your artistic spirit. You can create one of the following effects:

items: You instantly cause a message no more than 25 words in length to appear on a surface within range. The message appears in ink or paint and remains for 1 hour.

You touch unsculpted clay, a bottle of paint, or an ink pot and immediately shape it into an artistic work no larger than 2ft in any dimension. The work is fair but unimpressive to any discerning eye. The work remains for 1 hour.

You draw or sculpt a simple object worth no more than 1gp and it becomes real. The object is brittle and breaks under heavy use, close inspection reveals it to be made of worthless paste. If you have an example of an object on you when you cast the spell you can duplicate it, such as a specific key, otherwise the objects are generic. The object lasts for 1 hour or until it breaks.
You summon forth a splash of ink or paint at one target within 15ft attempting to blind them. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of their next turn.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action. If you cast a new one the oldest effect ends.

spell.name: Aqua Whip
entries: You lash out with a watery strike 5 feet wide and 15 feet long. Creatures within the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, and on a fail take {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone. You can also use this to pull a loose object that isn't worn or carried within the spell's range to you
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level {@dice 2d4}, 11th level {@dice 3d4}, and 17th level {@dice 4d4}.

spell.name: Decay
entries: You select a creature within range, as their body begins to rapidly rot. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, and on a fail the target takes {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage and deals half damage with all weapon attacks that use strength until the end of your next turn.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level {@dice 2d6}, 11th level {@dice 3d6}, and 17th level {@dice 4d6}.

spell.name: Light's Embrace
entries: A creature of your choice within range begins to glow with brilliant light, which causes them to shed bright light for 5ft, and dim light for another 5ft. During the spell's duration, creatures that can see the light have disadvantage on attack rolls that target that creature.

spell.name: Minor Magnetism
entries: You affect an item made of metal that you can see with a small magnetic force. You generate one of the following effects:

items: You move the object up to 30 feet.
You bend a piece of non magical metal up to 45 degrees.

entries: Creatures cannot be damaged by the movement of the object affected by the spell, nor can the spell move more than15 pounds at a time. This cannot affect an item currently wielded by a creature, unless the creature willingly allows it to be moved or the item is not.

spell.name: Minor Smite
entries: A weapon you are holding becomes cloaked in divine light. The next attack you make with the weapon during the duration uses your casting modifier to calculate its to-hit bonus and its damage bonus, instead of your strength. If you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, and on a fail they either cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn or are knocked prone (your choice).

spell.name: Overload
entries: A pulse of arcane energy launches out from your hand at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll, a target hit by this takes 1d4 force damage. If you cast a spell in the same turn as casting this cantrip, you take force damage equal to the level of that spell slot expended, a cantrip deals 1 damage.

spell.name: Deja Vu
entries: You slap a creature within range. They must make an Intelligence Saving throw, and on a fail, forget what happened in the past 6 seconds. If you or your allies had attacked this creature 10 minutes prior to casting the spell, they have advantage on the Saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or 4th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 minute ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or 6th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 10 minutes ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or 8th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 hour ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 week ago.

spell.name: Headlong Rush
entries: You embolden yourself with heroism. For the duration, your speed and jump distance/height is doubled when moving directly towards a hostile creature. After finishing moving, you can use your action to immediately make a melee weapon attack against a creature. On a hit, they take 2d8 bludgeoning damage + your spellcasting modifier and are knocked prone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you deal an additional 1d8 bludgeoning damage for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Hero's Helping Hand
entries: You give a hand to an injured creature. They regain 1d4 + your spellcasting modifier in hit points. If the creature was at 0 hit points, they immediately stand up if they were prone, and restore the highest number of hit points possible for the die rolled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the creature regains an additional 1d4 hit points for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Invigorating Word
entries: You speak a magical word that fills a creature with strength and energy. Choose one creature other than yourself within range that can hear you and understands at least one language you speak. Immediately after you cast the spell, that creature can use its reaction to make one action. This action can only be used to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage (and move 5 feet), or Use an Object.

spell.name: Last Light
entries: A burst of brilliant light ushers from you, each creature of your choice in a 20ft radius must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of their next turn. You shed bright light in a 20ft radius. At the start of you next turn the light vanishes and a burst of necrotic energy dealing 2d8 necrotic damage to each creature that was blinded by this spell and still within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range increases by 5 feet and the necrotic damage increases by 1d8 for each level past 1st.

spell.name: Orb of Recall
entries: You conjure an arcane orb that flies out in a straight line. All creatures that the orb passes through must make a DEX Save, and on a fail take 2d6 force damage. At the end of your turn, the orb flies back to your position, then dissipates. If the orb would pass through the same creature twice, they are unaffected by the 2nd pass

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Scribe

components.m: a silver feathered quill worth at least 50gp and a blank sheet of parchment.

entries: You touch a passage of text that is no larger than 5 square feet and transfer it instantly onto a nearby piece of parchment. The text is copied exactly including signatures, mistakes, or any other oddities within the original text. A DC 25 Investigation check can reveal the subtle markings that reveal magic was used in creating the text but does not necessarily reveal it to be a fake

spell.name: Wayfinder's Monument

components.m: a small tower built from nearby materials.

entries: You create a small monument, which creates a magical connection to you. During the spell's duration, you always know where the monument is, how far you are from the monument, if creatures of one certain type (your choice when you cast the spell) has passed within a 15ft radius of the monument, or if the monument is destroyed, which can be done by toppling the tower. Additionally once per 24 hours, you can channel for 10 minutes to transfer your senses into the monument, while your body becomes blinded and deafened to your surroundings. You can see, hear and smell from the monument, but you cannot speak through it. The connection ends when you choose to end it, or when you take damage.
If you cast this spell on the same area every day for 6 months, it becomes permanent until destroyed or dispelled.

spell.name: Bramble Barrier
entries: A mass of thick brambles and vines rapidly grows from a point within range. The brambles form into a tough dome with a diameter of 15ft, a height of 10ft and a thickness of 1ft. The dome has an AC of 13, has 30 hit points, with vulnerability to fire and immunity to psychic and poison. The brambles remain for the duration or as long as they have hit points. When casting the spell, you can choose to concentrate on it.

While concentrating on this spell, the brambles heal 5 hit points at the start of your turn. If you would lose concentration, the brambles remain for the remainder of their duration or once their hit points reach 0. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher, the brambles are conjured with an additional 10 maximum hit points.

spell.name: Dungrin's Light Spire
entries: You create a light spire within range, a glowing tree-like object that has a height of 10ft. It gives off dim light in a 30ft radius, and bright light within a 10ft radius. Creatures of your choice standing within its bright light gain a +1 to all saving throws. Creatures can only benefit from one Light Spire at a time.

spell.name: Recurring Remedy
entries: You generate a consistent stream of healing. Select a creature within range. For the duration, at the start of each of their turns they heal 1d4 hit points so long as they are conscious.

spell.name: Reveal
entries: With a wave of the hand and a magic word you bring to light that which is hidden. When you cast the spell choose one creature, object, or 10-foot cube within range. Any illusion spell of 2nd level or lower inside that area or effecting a creature or object immediately ends, if the spell is Invisibility or Greater Invisibility the spell ends regardless of level. For each spell of 3rd level or higher in the area, make an ability check with your spell casting ability. The DC for this check is 10 + spell's level. On a success the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the leave of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Strike Reflect
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a melee weapon attack, you strike back at your foe with magical force. You gain resistance to that attacks damage and the attacker then takes force damage equal to the damage you took, and then the attacker must make a Strength Saving Throw. On a fail, they are pushed back 15ft.

spell.name: Whirlpool
entries: You conjure a rapid pool of twisting water at a point within range. Creatures within a 15ft cube must make a strength saving throw. On a fail, they take 3d10 bludgeoning damage and are moved as close to the centre of the cube as they can. If they would knock into another creature, both creatures take 1d6 bludgeoning damage. If this spell is cast affecting creatures in water, they have disadvantage on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell deals an additional 1d10 damager per spell slot above 2nd level.

spell.name: Brilliant Spectre
entries: You transmute a lantern's flame into a Will-o'-Wisp. The Will-o'-Wisp is friendly to you, and remains for the spell's duration or once its hit points become 0. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the Will-o'-Wisp to perform an action. Additionally, you can give the Will-o'-Wisp a command once a certain event happens, like 'Notify me if anyone enters this area' or 'Attack any undead you see'. You can have up to three Will-o'-Wisp under your control at a time from this spell's effects. If you already have three Will-o'-Wisps under your control and you cast this spell again, that new Will-o'-Wisp becomes hostile towards you.

spell.name: Conjure Armory
entries: You pull forth a magical weapon rack. You additionally create up to 5 magical weapons of your choice and one suit of armor of your choice. If you create a weapon that requires ammunition, you also create 20 pieces of its type of ammunition. The rack, weapons, armor, and ammunition last for the duration, after which they vanish into dust.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional weapon per slot above 3rd, and 1 additional set of armor for every two slots above 3rd.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, the weapons are +1.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or higher, the weapons are +2.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th or higher, the weapons are +3.

spell.name: Chains of the Black Bloom
entries: You create a flurry of black petals and launch them at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll against that creature, and on a hit they take 4d10 slashing damage as rapidly moving petals tear around them. If this attack hits a creature, that creature is also restrained, as the petals turn to solid chains. If the spell hits, then all creatures of your choice within 10ft of that creature must make a Dexterity Saving throw, or also be restrained. Creatures restrained by this spell are freed at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you deal an additional 1d10 damage for every slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Frozen Winds of the Tomb
entries: You blow a freezing wind which envelops creatures in a 15 ft cone in front of you. All creatures but those with resistance or immunity to Cold Damage must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, ice begins to grow around their body. As an action, you can blow more freezing wind during the spell's duration. Creatures that fail subsequent saving throws have the freezing effect amplified. If a creature leaves the spell's cone, all effects of the spell are removed from them

items: (1 fail) Their speed is halved until the start of your next turn.
(2 fails) Previous effects, and the creature has disadvantage on all skill checks.
(3 fails) Previous effects, and attack rolls they make before the start of your next turn have disadvantage.
(4 fails) Previous effects, and the creature becomes restrained until the start of your next turn.
(5 fails) The creature becomes petrified in ice for 10 minutes. Any physical changes that occur while petrified carry over once they return to their original state.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the length of the cone increases by 5 feet for every spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Lunar Lance
entries: You conjure moonlight above your head and fire it in a spray of razor-sharp lances. For each creature in 100 feet long and 5 feet wide line make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, you deal 5d8 radiant damage and the next creature hit takes one less d8 of damage. The spell ends if it reaches 0 d8’s of damage or hits its maximum range. If any creature in the line is invisible you ignore the disadvantage imposed by not seeing them and if you hit, their invisibility ends

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Scurry of Quicklings
entries: You create seven illusory copies of quicklings around you, as you too change your appearance to look like a quickling. All quicklings are indistinguishable from another, and if a creature attempts to attack an illusory quickling it puffs into purple smoke. As a part of casting this spell, you can have all seven quicklings to move in any separate direction you desire up to 120ft. Additionally, your walking speed becomes 120ft for the duration. At the end of the spell's duration, all quicklings will attempt to hide where ever they can. If they cannot hide anywhere, they puff into purple smoke.

spell.name: Molten Cascade
entries: You conjure molten magma from your hands and launch it from you in a 20ft long and 10ft wide line. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity Saving Throw, and on a fail take 4d8 Fire Damage. Creatures that fail are then restrained, and on a subsequent turn must make a Strength Check against your Spell Save DC to break free from the now cooled rock that has encased them. Creatures that succeed take half of this damage and are not encased in rock. Another creature can use their action to break free someone trapped in the cooled rock

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Sinister Return
entries: You touch a creature with Necromantic energy. Make a spell attack roll, and on a hit the creature takes {@dice 6d6} Necrotic Damage. A hit humanoid must then make a constitution saving throw, and on a fail become cursed. If the cursed creature dies before completing three Long Rests, they rise as a zombie under your control.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Warrior's Epitaph
entries: Choose a location in range. A shimmering magical banner appears at that location. Each creature of your choice within 30ft of the banner gains advantage on all attack rolls made until the end of their next turn. In addition, whenever an ally starts its turn within 15 feet of the banner, they gain 1d4 + your spell casting ability mod in temporary hit points. A creature can pick up the banner and move it after it has appeared

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or 5th level slot, the amount of temporary hit points gained at the end of each turn increases to 1d6, at 6th or 7th level it increases to 1d8, and at 8th or 9th it increases to 1d10.

spell.name: Blade Halo

components.m: one miniature blade worth 5gp for each blade you summon

entries: A circle of four shimmering blades appears in your space, spinning around your body. The blades follow you if you move. As a bonus action on your turn, you can hurl one of the blades at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack, on a hit the target takes 2d8 magical slashing damage. The blade is then destroyed. You can instead of hurling the blade, grasp it, and make a melee spell attack which does 2d10 magical slashing damage on hit. For each blade remaining creatures that end their turn within 5ft of you take 1d4 magical slashing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, you summon one additional blade.

spell.name: Final Crescendo
entries: Running your fingers down the bowstring a beam of silver light springs towards your target and music fills the air. Select a creature within range, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a fail, you make them the target for a barrage of sonic attacks. On a success, they are still targeted but take half damage from any future effects. As a bonus action on each of your turns afterward, you can deal 2d8 thunder damage to the creature. Each additional time you use your bonus action in this way you deal 2d8 additional thunder damage. Once you reach 8d8 damage your bonus action instead deals 8d8 thunder damage in a 5ft radius around the target, each creature, including the target, must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, they take half damage. After this happens the spell ends. The spell ends early if you use your bonus action to do anything other than continuing the spell or if you are restrained or disarmed of the spellcasting focus.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increase by 1d6 for every spell slot above 4th.

spell.name: Light Charge
entries: You launch forth an intense ball of light. Creatures within its radius have their movement speed halved. As a Bonus Action on a subsequent turn after casting the spell, you can cause the light burst, which ends its effects. Creatures within the cube must make a Constitution Saving Throw, and on a fail take 4d6 radiant damage, or half as much to creatures that pass the saving throw. Each turn you are concentrating on the spell, it deals an additional 1d6 radiant damage when it bursts. If you would lose concentration on the spell at any time, it immediately bursts

spell.name: Lightning Rush
entries: Your body becomes enveloped in lightning. You become immune to lightning damage, you can squeeze through a space as small as 1 inch, and your movement speed is doubled. While this spell is active, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action, you don’t provoke attacks of opportunity, and any creatures you move through must make a DEX Save. On a fail, they take 3d6 lightning damage and are knocked prone, or half as much on a success. When the spell ends, your hair becomes frizzy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increases by 1d6 for every slot above 4th.

spell.name: Luminescent Lazerbeam
entries: A shining line of light fires out from your hands in a line 150 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution Saving throw. Creatures made of darkness, shadows, or smoke have disadvantage on the Saving throw. A creature takes 6d6 Radiant damage on a failed save and is blinded until the end of their turn, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increases by 1d6 for every slot above 4th.

spell.name: Magic Conduit

components.m: a spell scroll of a level 3 or lower spell slot, which is consumed

entries: A circle of arcane glyphs and runes appears on the ground within range. The circle has a 10ft radius and gives off faint light. While standing within the circle, yourself and those other creatures can use a Bonus Action to draw power from the circle, making the next spell they cast as an Action this turn upcasted by one level. They must remain in the circle while casting the spell for the increase to take effect. The conduit has 8 charges, and absorbing its power consumes a charge.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the conduit gains an additional 2 charges per every spell slots above 4th.

spell.name: Wishing Star
entries: You utter a magical prayer. At the beginning of your second turn after casting this spell, select up to 3 creatures within range. A comet flies by them, as they heal 45 hit points split between them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot or higher, it takes one less turn to complete.

spell.name: Elvinus' Ward of Conflux
entries: You conjure a ward of primal energy that surrounds your body and protects you from elemental magics. Choose one element from fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid damage. You gain resistance to that damage type. When you take damage from one of the listed damage types you can use your reaction to gain resistance to that damage type for the rest of the duration of the spell including the inciting instance of damage. Every time you use your reaction to switch resistances it replaces the previous resistance. In addition, any melee attacks that you hit with deal an extra 2d10 of the element you are currently resistant to.

spell.name: Fate Sealed
entries: You dash 30 feet forward pulling everything in your path and within your weapon’s reach on either side. Each creature hit must make a dexterity saving throw, taking 5d8 force Damage, or half as much on a fail. Those that fail are also left prone after being knocked into the air

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level slot or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every slot above 5th.

spell.name: Globes of the Land
entries: You designate two 15ft radius spheres within range and swap the contents of them. Each creature in the sphere moves to a new location in the other sphere of your choice along with everything they are wearing and carrying. An unwilling creature must make a Charisma saving throw, on a success they are not moved. Objects are also moved unless they are affixed to the ground, such as a plant, or are not fully inside the radius, such as a cart that is halfway into the radius.

spell.name: Knox's Numerous Platforms
entries: You summon a pane of magical force 10ftx10ft and 1 inch thick. The pane can appear in an unoccupied space within range and be oriented in any direction. The pane can be opaque or transparent or somewhere in the middle. For the duration of the spell you can summon another pane as an action or move up to three summoned platforms up to 30ft. If you summon more panes than the spell slot used to cast the spell one pane of your choice vanishes. The panes can support 1000lbs of weight each, if more weight than this is applied to one it shatters

Nothing can physically pass through the panes. They are immune to all damage but force and cannot be dispelled by dispel magic. Each pane has an AC of 10 and 25 hit points. If a platform is destroyed it does not count against the number of summoned platforms.

spell.name: Magnetic Sphere

components.m: a small magnet worth 10gp, which is consumed

entries: You conjure a reflective metallic sphere in range. The sphere is 1ft in radius and hovers 5ft above the ground. It emits a magnetic force in a 45ft radius of the sphere that pulls in metal objects. Upon casting the spell, entering its zone for the first time, or starting your turn within its zone,loose metal objects within the magnetic force are flung towards the sphere and stick to it for the duration of the spell. Metal objects that are held require the wielder to make a Strength Save, and on a fail the objects are flung towards the sphere and stick to it. To retrieve an object stuck on the sphere, a creature must make a Strength Check equal to the spell save DC to successfully remove them from the sphere.

Creatures wearing metal armor are more susceptible to its effects. A creature wearing medium armor made primarily of metal must make a Strength Save, and on a fail, their body is flung towards the sphere and will then be stuck to it. A creature wearing light armor also makes the save, but with advantage. A creature wearing heavy armor makes the save with disadvantage. While stuck to the sphere, the creature is considered restrained. A creature may attempt an Athletics check to remove itself or another creature stuck to the sphere. The same advantages and disadvantages as detailed above depending on the armor type applies to this check.

Creatures that are pulled to the centre of the sphere by its effect take fall damage equivalent of the range traveled. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, when casting the spell you can instead have the orb repulse objects made of metal. Objects are then instead flung outwards of the sphere’s zone of magnetism. Creatures wearing armor are still affected by the same advantages and disadvantages as detailed above.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level slot or higher, its radius is doubled and the caster can alternate between its two modes as a Bonus Action.

spell.name: Tempest
entries: You create a raging tornado within range. The tornado has a diameter of 20ft, and a height of 100ft. As a Bonus Action on your turn, you can move the tornado up to 30ft in a straight line. Creatures that enter the tornado or start their turn within the tornado must make a Strength Saving throw, and on a fail are flung up into the air inside of the tornado. Creatures affected by the tornado take 5d4 bludgeoning damage at the start of their turns, additionally affected creatures cannot concentrate on spells, fail dexterity saving throws, cannot use a fly speed if they have one and are deafened. Creatures affected are flung a number of feet into the air equal to 1d10 x 10 when they start their turn. If a creature goes higher than the top of the tornado, they are shot out of the top of the tornado in a random direction and fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level slot or higher, the cube size is increased by 5ft per spell slot above 5th level.

spell.name: Arcane Barrage
entries: Your body becomes enveloped in arcane energy. You shed bright light for 15ft, and dim light for another 15ft. Your movement speed becomes 0, you cannot benefit from movement in any way while this spell is active, and you have disadvantage on Dexterity Saving throws. While in this form, you gain access to a Ranged Spell attack roll, which deals 4d4 force damage + your casting modifier, with a range of 300 ft. As an Action, you can fire up to three of these Ranged Spell attacks while in this form. You can use an Action to regain your ability to move and your movement speed for the turn but lose the ability to make the aforementioned Shots, after which you can use a Bonus Action to reactivate this form, losing your movement once again.
When the spell ends, you have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Saving throws and Ability checks until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level slot or higher, you can fire an additional shot for every slot above 6th.

entries.name: Age
entries: Darfellan can grow to be 130 years old, reaching maturity around 25.

entries.name: Size
entries: Darfellan are 6-7ft on average, being quite bulky. Your Size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Darfellan have darkvision in a range of 60ft, seeing things in darkness in shades of deep blues.

entries.name: Language
entries: Darfellan speak, read and write Common and Aquan.

entries.name: Darfellan Skills
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}. Darfellan are all also proficient the {@item net|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item javelin|phb}, and {@item spear|phb}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your tough skin provides you a Natural Armor Class of 13 +Your Dexterity Bonus. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Ice Diver
entries: You take no penalties from swimming in freezing water. Additionally, you can hold your breath a number of hours equal to their Constitution Modifier + 1 (minimum 1).

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Myconids are pacifist and lean towards Neutrality on most occasions.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is small, but you're a fast grower. You start out anywhere between 1 and 2 feet tall. You become a Medium Creature when you become a Myconid Adult, growing to 5ft. You grow to just under 7ft as a Sovereign.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 25ft. Your speed increases to 30ft when you become a Myconid Adult.

entries.name: Fungal Growth
entries: Myconids go through a process of evolution as they mature.At level 1, you are a Myconid Sprout. At level 4, you become a Myconid Adult. At level 7, you become a Myconid Sovereign. Your features change based off what stage of life you are in.

entries.name: Sunlight Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

entries.name: Melding Rest
entries: Myconids don’t need to sleep. Instead, they release calming spores, remaining semiconscious for 6 hours a day. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Underdark Vision
entries: You have darkvision in a range of 120ft.

entries.name: Fungal Resilience
entries: Your fungal body has an easy time adapting to strange airborne toxins. You face no negative effects of polluted air, and have advantage on saving throws against harmful gases and vapors, such as Cloudkill..

entries.name: Spores
entries: As your Myconid matures, they learn ways to use their spores. As a Sprout, you can use your Rapport Spores. As anAdult, you can use Pacifying Spores. The Sovereign learns Hallucination Spores.

entries.name: Rapport Spores (1/day)
entries: A 10-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren’t undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores (1/day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5feet of it. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + prof + CON) or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores (1/day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5feet of it. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + prof + CON) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Sovereign
entries: When you become a Sovereign, you gain the Powerful Build feature and have advantage on all checks to communicate with other Myconid, as they see you as someone to be respected.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Myconid can write and understand Common and Undercommon. Myconids can speak any language they can understand by expelling spores at a creature.

entries.name: Cold Adaptation
entries: You have advantage on Constitution Saving Throws against cold weather, and have resistance to Cold Damage.

entries.name: Frost Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Frostbite|XGE} Cantrip. At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell Ice Knife|XGE} spell and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it. At 5th level, you learn {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|XGE} and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it.

entries.name: Desert's Guide
entries: You can see small details within the Desert's landscape. You cannot get lost except by magical means while traveling through deserts, canyons, mesas or badlands. You can spend10 minutes to gather enough water from underground deposits to fill a waterskin.

entries.name: Dunish Magic
entries: You have learned magic to aid in your survival. You learn the {@spell Druidcraft|phb} cantrip. At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell Create or Destroy Water|phb} spell and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it. At 5th level, you learn {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

item.name: Naginata
entries: Special. This weapon only has the reach property when it is being wielded in both hands.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Shuang Gou
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
When you are wielding two Shuang Gou you are considered to have reach.
If you use the reach property you can’t make an offhand attack that turn.
Additionally, you have advantage on attack rolls made to disarm opponents if you are wielding two Shuang Gou.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Meteor Hammer
entries: <b><i>Reach.(10ft)<b><i> This weapon adds 10 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Tonfa
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
When you are wielding two tonfa you gain a +1 bonus to your AC. If you make an attack with both Tonfa on your turn you lose the bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Urumi
entries: Special. If you roll a natural 1 while using the Urumi you deal 1d8 slashing damage to yourself.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Chakram
entries: Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Ceatus
entries: Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Iron Ceatus
entries: Special. These heavy gauntlets require immense strength to use effectively. A creature must have 15 Strength or they make all attacks with this weapon with disadvantage.

Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Bassinet Claws
entries: Special. As a bonus action you can extended or retract the claws from these knuckles switching your unarmed damage from Bludgeoning to Slashing while the claws are extended.
Hidden. A creature gains advantage on Sleight of Hand checks to hide a hidden weapon on their person. In addition, spotting a Hidden weapon on a person requires a DC 15 Perception check.

Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Shell Blades
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
These blades have a heavily guarded hilt that protects the forearms of its wielder. While wielding two of these blades you gain a +1 to AC.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Bardiche
entries: Special. The special hooked head of the Bardiche allows one to bypass an opponent's shield. As a bonus action when you make an attack roll with the Bardiche against a creature with a shield you can have them make an opposed Athletic check. If you win then the creature does not benefit from the AC bonus from their shield until the end of your turn.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Slingsword
entries: Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Bolas
entries: Special. A Large or smaller creature hit by a bola must make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check verse the attack roll. If they failed, they are knocked prone. A bola has no effect on creatures that are form lessor that don't have legs. Creatures with more than four legs have advantage on the check.

item.name: Bladed Net
entries: Special. A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is Restrained until it is freed. A net has no Effect on Creatures that are formless or Creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its Action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. On a failure, the creature takes 1d4 slashing damage. Dealing 10 slashing damage to the net (AC 13) also frees the creature without harming it, Ending the Effect and destroying the net. When you use an Action,bonus Action, or Reaction to Attack with a net, you can make only one Attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Man Catcher
entries: Special. A creature can make a grapple check with the reach of the Man Catcher. On a success the grappler can move and maintain the grapple as long as they remain with the weapon’s reach. If a second creature attempts to grapple a creature you are grappling you can grant them advantage. If three or more Man Catchers are all grappling the same creature, that creature is restrained instead, as long as all three maintain the restraint.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Katana
entries: Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

item.name: Throwing Star
entries: Special. After using a Throwing Star for your Attack Action, you can use your Bonus Action to throw an additional Star, provided you have another. You can hold up to three Stars in one hand at a time.
Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

item.name: Throwing Star (Bundle of 10)
entries: Most commonly sold in bundles of 10 {@item throwing star|TftJC}.

item.name: Deneith Oasis Gemstone Fragment
entries: To use the fragment you must have it on your person. Once per dawn the fragment can be used to do one of the following things.

entries.name: As a bonus action
items: regain a first level spell slot.
Cast a first level spell. The spell stored in the fragment is listed below based on the color of the shard. The DC is 13 for the spell casted through the fragment.

item.name: Deneith Cave Gemstone Fragment
entries: To use the fragment you must have it on your person. Once per dawn the fragment can be used to do one of the following things.

entries.name: As a bonus action
items: expend one hit die and regain that much hp.
Use a maneuver. The maneuver stored in the fragment is listed below based on the color of the shard. The DC is 13 and your superior die is 1d6 for the maneuvers.

item.name: Heart of Ice
entries: You gain resistance to Cold Damage. If you already have resistance from another source, this either becomes resistance to Necrotic Damage, or immunity to Cold (your choice).
Your Charisma Score and its maximum increase by 2, up to 30.
Whenever you succeed on a Saving Throw, the Amulet bursts with Ice. Your next weapon or spell attack in the next minute deals additional damage equal to your Charisma Modifier.

item.name: Katana of Astral Speed
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.
You gain a fly speed of 60ft while in the Astral Sea.
Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

item.name: Blade of Darkinix
entries: This weapon provides a +3 to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls.
As an Action, the wielder can change this into any melee weapon they are proficient with.
In all forms, it has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.
You gain Immunity to Fire Damage.
Your Charisma Score becomes 20 if it is lower than that.
This weapon deals an additional {@dice 3d6} damage against Dragons.

This weapon is also considered a {@item Vorpal Sword|DMG} against Dragons, so long as they are at 100 hit points or fewer. If they are above this value, they instead take an additional {@dice 6d8} damage.

item.name: The Red Blade
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
While wielding this blade, you can cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|PHB}, {@spell Ensnaring Strike|PHB}, {@spell Pass Without Trace|PHB} and {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} once per long rest, each.
Additionally, you no longer need to drink water, and have advantage on Constitution saving throws against overheating.
When you hit with a melee attack using this sword and reduce the target to 0 hit points, you gain 2d6 temporary hit points.
Your theft shall not be forgotten, and my vengeance shall be swift.

item.name: Fate Coin
entries: As a reaction you can flip this coin into the air and place your fate in its hands. Roll {@dice 1d2}.
On a 1, your next roll becomes a natural 20 and you have advantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of your next turn.
On a 2, your next roll becomes a natural 1 and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of your next turn.
After the coin has been flipped it bursts into sparkles.

item.name: Claws of the Wyrmling (Green)
entries: This magic claw can be attached to a melee weapon you are proficient in.
Once attached, it cannot be removed without the use of a {@spell Remove Curse|PHB} spell or similar magic.
If you unattune to it, the attachment remains however you no longer gain the benefits of this magic item.
While attached to a weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls made with that weapon.
Draconic Fury. When you hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, you can add an additional {@dice 1d4} poison damage to the attack.

Draconic Venom. On a successful hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Amulet of the Elemental Knights
entries: Once per month, as an action you can summon a Myrmidon. The Myrmidon is friendly to you and will give its life to fight for you and protect you. The Myrmidon vanishes after its hit points reach 0, or a week passes.

item.name: Frostwail
entries: This maul of ice and ivory bears a never melting heavy head.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magical weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon you deal {@dice 2d6} cold damage.

When you land a critical hit the maul head explodes dealing {@dice 3d12} cold damage to each creature of your choice within 10ft of you. The maul head then takes (@dice 1d4} rounds to reform, during this time the maul cannot deal damage.

item.name: Lance of the Steadfast Prince
item.reqAttune: by a creature with at least 15 CHA
entries: You gain a +3 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.
If you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you deal an additional 2d8 necrotic damage and regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.
Additionally, your walking speed is increased by 10, and if you are mounted this walking speed is bonus is instead applied to your mount.
Special. You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: Dark Storm's Voice
entries: This magical hammer grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.
The hammer constantly hums with the power of the storm and is cloaked in a dark shadow and when called upon can unleash the fury of the storm.
As an action, you can make one melee weapon attack which increases your reach by 30 feet and deals thunder damage instead of bludgeoning damage.
While in darkness or dim light, the maul becomes shrouded in shadow becoming nearly unperceivable. While shrouded in shadow this maul's bludgeoning damage ignores damage resistances.
Additionally, you can use the hammer to cast {@spell thunderwave|PHB} with a DC of 14.

item.name: Gloom
entries: This blood-soaked rapier has taken countless lives and is suffused with its previous wielder's malice. Attacks with this magical rapier gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls.
While in darkness or dim light, the blade becomes shrouded in shadow becoming nearly unperceivable. While shrouded in shadow this blade's damage ignores damage resistances.

item.name: Banner of Lathander
entries: Crafted from a thick, red fabric, this banner measures 5 feet high and 3 feet wide. The bears the holy symbol of Lathander. It can be attached to a 10-foot pole to serve as a standard. Furling or unfurling the banner requires an action. The banner has the following properties.

items: Mark of Courage. As a bonus action, you can touch the unfurled banner and cause it to emanate courage. You and your allies are immune to the frightened condition while within 20 feet of it. This benefit lasts for 10 minutes or until the banner is furled. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Sentinel Standard. Undead of CR 5 or lower have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws when within 20 feet of the unfurled banner.

Standard's Shield. As a bonus action, you can touch the unfurled banner and invoke this power. Any ranged attack roll that targets you or an ally of yours has disadvantage if the target is within 20 feet of the unfurled banner. This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until the banner is furled. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Gift of Battle. You can transfer the banner's magic to a place by tracing the rune on the ground with your finger. The point where you trace it becomes the center of a spherical area of magic that has a 500-foot radius and that is fixed to the place. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the banner to be within 5 feet of you and during which you choose creatures, creature types, or both that will benefit from the magic. At the end, the banner is destroyed, and the area gains the following property:
While in the 500-foot-radius sphere, the creatures you chose during the transfer process are immune to the frightened condition and gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and AC.

item.name: Bulwark
entries: This magical shield projects an additional shield of force around itself when activated. As a bonus action, you can activate the shield to increase its AC value by +3. While in this state you also have resistance to force damage and immunity to the magic missile spell.

While the shield is activated and you succeed on a Dexterity saving throw that effects more than one creature you can choose to extend its protection to all allies within 30 feet. Each creature within 30 feet automatically succeeds on the Dexterity saving throw and suffers no damage or negative effects. You suffer the full effect of the saving throw as if you had failed the save. Once you use this ability the shield becomes inactive, and cannot be activated again until you finish a short or long rest.
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Combat and War
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Weapon Attack Rolls.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Art, Music and Literature
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Musical Instruments and Artisan Supplies.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Inventions and Technology
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Tools Checks

item.name: Encyclopedia of Social Culture
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Persuasion and Deception

item.name: Encyclopedia of the Lands and History
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to History and Nature Checks

item.name: Spear of Thassa
item.reqAttune: by a follower of a Thassa
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hurl it and speak its command word, it transforms into a torrent of water, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet. Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} cold damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The torrent  turns back into a spear when it reaches the target. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes damage from the spear plus {@dice 4d6} cold damage. This ability does an additional {@dice 2d6} cold damage when used underwater.
The spear’s property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the spear can still be used as a magic weapon.
The Spear retains all properties from its Staff Form.

item.name: Flail of Disruption
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a fiend or an undead with this magic weapon, that creature takes an extra {@dice 2d6} radiant damage. If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
While you hold this weapon, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

item.name: Compass of the Guiding Arrow
entries: The Compass of the Guiding Arrow is a finely crafted magical compass that aids adventurers in locating specific items of significance. This compass is currently linked. This compass is treated as +1 {@item navigator's tools|PHB}.

Linking. To link or unlink to a specific item, the attuned user must be within 5 ft of the item and spend 1 minute concentrating on severing/connecting the connection. As if they were concentrating on a spell. You cannot link a new item if it is already linked.

Guiding Arrow. the compass's arrow constantly points in the direction of the chosen item. It provides a reliable guide, even if the item is hidden, obscured, but must be on the same plane of existence. The arrow adjusts its direction as the user moves, always pointing towards the desired object.

Protection from Interference. The Compass of the Guiding Arrow possesses a magical shielding that prevents external forces from manipulating or disrupting its guidance. It cannot be affected by spells or abilities that alter the accuracy of directional devices.

item.name: Anchor of the Deep
entries: The Anchor of the Deep appears to be an old, rusted anchor covered in intricate, weathered runes. When this anchor is used, it triggers a powerful magical effect that causes the entire ship to sink rapidly to the bottom of the sea. However, rather than resulting in tragedy, the occupants of the ship find themselves under the effect of the water breathing spell.

Breath of the Depths. Once per long rest, as an action, you can embed the Anchor of the Deep into the deck of a ship or a similar structure. When activated, the anchor triggers a powerful enchantment that causes the ship to sink quickly to the ocean floor, also everyone currently on the ship will gain the effects of the {@spell water breathing|PHB} spell as if the spell was casted on them. This lasts for 24 hours or until the anchor is retrieved and the ship resurfaces. To resurface the ship, as an action the user attuned to it must retrieve the anchor. Once the anchor is lifted, the ship ascends back to the surface, breaking the water's surface and returning to its normal state. It takes 1 minute to sink to the bottom or to float back up. The ship is unharmed from when it sinks.

item.name: Candle of Brilliant Arcana
entries: These candles hold a powerful magical charge. When a magic item within 30ft of a candle uses a charge, you can have the candles restore its power. It regains an expended charge or use. After it has done so, the candle loses its magical ability.

item.name: Puck
entries: This brightly colored disk is made of some sort of wondrous material and can bend easily. When inverted it will quickly spring itself back to its normal shape, propelling objects on top of it 30 feet into the air. It is an action to arm the Puck and it detonates whenever someone steps onto it or at the start of your next turn. After being used, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 1 or 2, the Puck snaps and becomes useless.

item.name: Propeller Hat
entries: This hat can be activated to grant a fly speed of 15 feet to the wearer until the end of their turn. It takes a bonus action to activate. After being used, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 1 or 2, the propeller snaps and the hat becomes useless.

item.name: Waxy Pie
entries: This tasty pie can be shared with up to 4 other people. If shared during a short rest each person that eats it can add {@dice 1d4} to one hit die spent during the short rest. The pie magically reappears each day at midnight.

item.name: Bonetooth Necklace
entries: This Necklace magically collects trophies from your hunts. You can spend an hour performing a Ritual to prepare a Hunt. A creature can only be hunted if;

items: You know their name, you have seen them in person and have spoken with them
They are a level or CR higher than your level
Wish you dead

entries: If a creature meets these conditions, you can Hunt them. Upon killing the target of your Hunt, a piece of them is magically added to the necklace.
You gain a +1 to attack rolls per trophy collected. At 5 Trophies, the item changes.

item.name: Riftgem (Plane of Fire)
entries: This gemstone is filled with magic from the Plane of Fire. So long as the portal it is connected to remains open, it remains magical. While attuned, you can use this as an Arcane Focus. You ignore Resistance to Fire Damage when dealing Fire Damage with a Spell cast through the Riftgem. Additionally, whenever you cast a spell that expends a spell slot through the Riftgem that would deal Fire Damage, you can have it Burst.

A Spell that Bursts deals additional Fire damage to all creatures within 5ft of those who were affected by the spell. This damage equals {@dice 1d6} for spells of 1st-2nd level, {@dice 2d6} for spells of 3rd-4th level, {@dice 3d6} for spells of 5th-6th level, {@dice 4d6} for spells of 7th-8th level, and {@dice 5d6} for spells of 9th level.
Finally, while within 60ft of the portal this gem is connected to, you gain resistance to Fire Damage.

item.name: Riftgem (Feywilds)
entries: This gemstone is filled with magic from the Feywilds. So long as the portal it is connected to remains open, it remains magical. While attuned, you can use this as an Arcane Focus. Whenever you would cast a spell that expends a spell slot using this as a Focus, you can enhance the spell.

An enhanced spell is upcasted by 1 level. This may cause a Wild Magic Surge. Roll {@dice 1d2}, and on a 2, roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} Table. If the result is a spell that normally requires concentration, it doesn’t require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.
Additionally, if the spell that was enhanced was an Enchantment spell, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Casting Modifier.
Finally, while within 60ft of the portal this gem is connected to, you gain a +1 to your Armor class and all saving throws.

entries.caption: Wild Magic Surge
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
For the next minute, you can see any {@condition invisible} creature if you have line of sight to it.
A {@filter modron|bestiary|source=mm|search=modron} chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell fireball} as a 3rd-level spell centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell magic missile} as a 5th-level spell.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you shrink. If the roll is even, you grow.
You cast {@spell confusion} centered on yourself.
For the next minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns.
You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze, at which point the feathers explode out from your face.
You cast {@spell grease} centered on yourself.
Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the next spell you cast in the next minute that involves a saving throw.
Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. A {@spell remove curse} spell can end this effect.
An eye appears on your forehead for the next minute. During that time, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
For the next minute, all your spells with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.
You are transported to the Astral Plane until the end of your next turn, after which time you return to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
Maximize the damage of the next damaging spell you cast within the next minute.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you get younger (minimum 1 year old). If the roll is even, you get older.
{@dice 1d6} {@creature flumph||flumphs} controlled by the DM appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you and are {@condition frightened} of you. They vanish after 1 minute.

You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While a plant, you are {@condition incapacitated} and have vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 hit points, your pot breaks, and your form reverts.
For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.
A {@creature unicorn} controlled by the DM appears in a space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
A spectral shield hovers near you for the next minute, granting you a +2 bonus to AC and immunity to {@spell magic missile}.
You are immune to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next {@dice 5d6} days.
Your hair falls out but grows back within 24 hours.
For the next minute, any flammable object you touch that isn't being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame.
You regain your lowest-level expended spell slot.
For the next minute, you must shout when you speak.
You cast {@spell fog cloud} centered on yourself.
Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take {@damage 4d10} lightning damage.
You are {@condition frightened} by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes {@condition invisible} for the next minute. The invisibility ends on a creature when it attacks or casts a spell.
You gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} hours.
You glow with bright light in a 30-foot radius for the next minute. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
You cast {@spell polymorph} on yourself. If you fail the saving throw, you turn into a sheep for the spell's duration.
Illusory butterflies and flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of you for the next minute.
You can take one additional action immediately.
Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt.
You cast {@spell fly} on a random creature within 60 feet of you.
You become {@condition invisible} for the next minute. During that time, other creatures can't hear you. The invisibility ends if you attack or cast a spell.
If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the {@spell reincarnate} spell.
Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to piercing damage for the next minute.
You are surrounded by faint, ethereal music for the next minute.
You regain all expended sorcery points.

item.name: Crown of Crimson
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting that uses their Charisma
entries: You gain a +2 to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. When you would cast a spell that requires Gemstones as an expended material component, the cost of the gemstones is lowered by 100 for you.

item.name: Amulet of the Elemental Adept
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting that uses their Charisma
entries: This amulet is inset with four gems, ruby, sapphire, diamond, and opal. One gem always softly glows in an inner light. While illuminated each gem confers power to the user. While the ruby is illuminated your fire damage ignores resistance and you can cast {@spell burning hands|PHB}. While the sapphire is illuminated your cold damage ignores resistance and you can cast {@spell ice knife|XGE}. While the diamond is illuminated your force damage ignores resistance and you can cast {@spell zephyr strike|XGE}. While the opal is illuminated your bludgeoning damage ignores resistances and you can cast {@spell earth tremor|XGE}.

Each time you cast a spell from the amulet the illuminated gem changes, following this order Opal->Ruby->Sapphire->Diamond. Once a gems power has been used it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

When all 4 gems are exhausted the amulet itself begins to glow. While in this state you have resistance to fire, cold, force, and bludgeoning damage. This state lasts for one minute before the amulet becomes unusable until the gems are recharged. When this state is activated, the wearing must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become possessed by the spirit of Vestkarl Thunderlance, a chaotic evil druid.
Each night, roll {@dice 1d4}, this determines the starting gem for that day:

items: Ruby
Sapphire
Diamond
Opal

item.name: Moonlight Pendant
entries: This pendant can store moonlight. If left out in the moonlight for 1 hour, it gains a charge. It can hold up to 10 charges at a time. You can expend a charge to be treated as in moonlight for your Lycanthropy.
Additionally, during a full moon, you can now make a DC 17 WIS save to control your cravings.

item.name: Prism of the Moon
entries: This crystal prism can be used as an arcane focus. While using it the holder can change the damage type of any cantrip they cast to fire, acid, radiant, poison, cold, lightning, or psychic. Doing so consumes one charge from the prism, which holds up to 7 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4} charges when it spends a night in moonlight.

item.name: Icebreaker
entries: You gain a +2 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.
When you cast a spell that deals Cold Damage, you can apply this sword's bonus to the Spell Attack Roll, or increase its saving throw by 2 (whichever applies).
If you make an attack with this weapon after dealing Cold Damage in the past minute, this weapon’s Critical Hit Range is increased by 1.

item.name: Zyrial, Heart of the Sea
entries: While wearing or holding this magical gem you can commune with the spirit trapped within to create a powerful magical implement. As an action, you can target one non-magical weapon, armor, or spellcasting focus that you are holding and wearing and cause it to become encrusted with magical gemstones.

Encrusted Weapon. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this now magical weapon. In addition, you deal {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a hit. On scoring a critical hit you deal {@dice 3d6} cold damage to each creature of your choice within 5 feet of the original target.

Bejeweled Armor. You gain a +2 bonus to your AC while wearing the bejeweled armor. In addition, when you take radiant or force damage you take {@dice 1d6} less of that damage. Upon dropping to zero hp points you instead drop to zero and regain {@dice 2d6} hit points. Once this feature has been used the armor becomes non-magical and Zyrial ceases to function for 1 week.

Dazzling Focus. A spell cast with this spell-casting focus gains a +2 to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. In addition, when you deal cold, force, or radiant damage you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} slashing damage. Spells that deal cold, force, or radiant damage to a single target score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

Crystal of the Sea. As an action or as a reaction to taking cold damage, you can cause Zyrial to manifest a suit of crystal armor that engulfs your entire body. This armor sets your AC to 18, 20 if Zyrial was active as Bejeweled Armor, and imposes disadvantage on stealth checks, this armor counts as heavy armor and you are proficient with it while wearing it. This armor lasts for 10 minutes or until you use an action to dismiss it. While active you are immune to cold damage. After using this feature you cannot manifest this armor again until you finish a long rest.
If you use your action to encrust another object the enchantment on a currently encrusted object fades as the crystals fall away.
Sentience. Zyrial is a sentient neutral good object with an Intelligence of 12, Wisdom of 12, and a Charisma of 16. It has hearing and blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.
This object can speak, read, and understand Common and Aquan, and can communicate with its wielder telepathically.

item.name: Eclipse Sol
entries: This simple blackened sword hilt is covered with delicate Celestial runes.

As a bonus action, the wielder can bring the blade to life, if it is currently day a vibrant golden blade of light springs to life from the hilt, if it is currently night a dark blade of shadow appears instead. The light blade deals {@dice 1d10} Radiant damage and the shadow blade deals {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage. If the blade is summoned during an eclipse, or on a plane that does not have a day or night cycle it instead summons a twilight blade of light and shadow. This blade deals {@dice 1d8} necrotic and {@dice 1d8} radiant.
The blades summoned gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

When a creature is reduced to zero hit points with this blade a small mote of light breaks off from the blade and orbits the wielders head. This mote can be grasped as a bonus action, allowing the wielder to make a ranged spell attack (+9 to hit) against one creature within 120 feet. The beam deals {@dice 3d12} radiant damage on hit. Up to 4 motes can orbit the wielder at once. If the blade is deactivated or dropped all motes vanish.
While the blade is active the wielder can teleport at will. Teleporting requires two feet of movement for every foot traveled.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Amulet of Average
entries: This golden amulet is adorned with the likeness of two different feminine visages on either side of its coin-like form.
While attuned to this item, the wearer gains a +1 bonus to all ability checks and saving throws made without proficiency.

Cursed. This amulet is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the amulet, insisting on wearing it at all times. You cannot unattune to the amulet while cursed in this way. A {@spell remove curse|PHB} or similar magic immediately unattunes the wearer, ending the curse.

Curse of the Average. While attuned to the amulet, the wearer suffers a -1 penalty to all ability checks and saving throws made with proficiency. Additionally, the wearer staunchly believes the amulet brings them good luck, and becomes hostile towards those who would attempt to remove them of the amulet.

item.name: Staff of Arachnid Domination
entries: The staff allows the wielder to control arachnids, such as spiders and ettercaps, within a certain range.

While holding the staff, the wielder can use an action target to any arachnid within 60 feet. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 15 or be charmed by the wielder for 1 hour. The wielder can use their bonus action on subsequent rounds to maintain control over the charmed creature, causing it to take any actions they desire.

Additionally, once per day, Target up to three creatures within 60 feet. The affected creatures must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 15 or be magically {@condition restrained} for 1 minute while they struggle to untangle themselves from the web of lies and deceit. The affected creatures can make the save again at the end of their turn.
While attuned to the staff, the wielder gains resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against poison effects.

item.name: Gauntlets of the Frigid North
entries: While you wear both of these steel gauntlets, any non-magical weapon you grasp with either gauntlet is treated as a magic weapon.

As a bonus action, you can use the gauntlets to cause ice to envelop one or two melee weapons in your grasp. Each icy weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a hit. The ice last until you sheath or let go of either weapon. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
In addition, you can touch one 5-foot cube of water and cause it to freeze for 1 hour.

item.name: Shiverspike
entries: You gain a +1 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.

Whenever you would take or deal Cold damage, you gain Temporary Hit points equal to your Proficiency Bonus, as Ice crystals coalesce around you. Whenever you would hit a creature this weapon, you can remove any Temporary Hit points you have to cause the attack to deal additional cold damage equal to the temporary hit points removed.

item.name: Scarf of the Rushing Tides
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals cold damage or restores hit points roll {@dice 1d8} and add it to the damage or healing. In addition, you gain resistance to cold damage and when you suffer cold damage you reduce the damage by {@dice 1d4}.
You gain a swim speed equal to 60 feet and can breathe underwater.

Curse. You require 6x as much water as others. If you go more than 4 hours without drinking at least 1 liter of water you have disadvantage on all Strength and Constitution saving throws and ability checks until you drink.

Shackles of Farlanki. This item contains the spirit of a destructive elemental leviathan known as Doluna. While this scarf is not being worn by someone the enchantment magic holding Doluna at bay begins to wane. After {@dice 1d6+2} days the scarf vanishes and transforms into a portal into the Elemental Plane of Water. After {@dice 2d4+2} days the magic fails entirely and Doluna is freed.

item.name: The Mantle of Pyfrita
entries: While active this cloak sheds dim light for 30ft. Creatures that attack you while it's active have disadvantage and if they are within 5 feet of you when they hit take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. After being hit the cloak deactivates and must be reactivated with a bonus action.
Sage of the Forge. You gain proficiency in smith’s tools. If you already have smith’s tools proficiency you instead add twice your proficiency bonus to your rolls.

When you finish a long rest you can choose one metal weapon, suit of armor, or shield and enchant it with a fiery light. If it is a weapon it deals {@dice 2d6} extra fire damage on a hit, if it is a shield or suit of armor it grants fire and radiant resistance until your next long rest
Cursed. While wearing the cloak you are vulnerable to cold damage.

Form of the Pyre. As an action, you can set loose the spirit contained within the cloak to fight alongside you. The spirit takes on the form of an Elemental from the following list: Fire Elemental Myrmidon, Cinder Hulk, Salamander, or Fire Elemental.
While the spirit is active and has more than 0 hit points, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain immunity to fire damage.
Melee spell and weapon attacks deal 2d6 extra fire damage.
If you cast a spell that deals fire damage roll {@dice 1d6}, on a result of 6 the spell does not consume a spell slot.

entries: When the spirit drops to 0 hit points or 1 hour passes, it vanishes, and you lose the benefits listed above. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 90 days. As an action, you can cast a 5th level or higher spell that deals fire damage into the Mantle to lower the time to wait by 1 day.

item.name: Bracers of the Mountain Cliffs
entries: You gain proficiency in Athletics, if you already have proficiency you gain expertise. Whenever you make an athletics check to push, pull, or otherwise move a creature you do so with advantage.

When you force a creature to move through an attack or spell they move an additional 10ft and take {@dice 2d6} Bludgeoning damage. In addition, if the creature has a fly speed that speed is reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn.
Curse. The heavy gauntlets weigh you down, your speed decreases by 15ft.

Shackles of Jurajuru. This item contains the spirit of a destructive elemental zaratan known as Cavalkal.
